Text: Mining Ship: \n You're approaching Mining Site #4.
Mining Ship: \n #101, what's your internal pressure?
Miner #101: \n Pressure nominal.
Mining Ship: \n Disengaging safeties.
Mining Ship: \n Systems are go for descent into high concentration area.
Mining Ship: \n Lowering cage.
Mining Ship: \n #101, internal pressure nominal. Breathing and heart rate normal.
Miner #101: \n Maybe, but I'm not feeling so hot.
Mining Ship: \n #101, you're breaking up. Repeat again?
Miner #101: \n Nothing.
Mining Ship: \n We've got a lot of movement, be careful.
Mining Ship: \n Cage depth at 90... 95... 100...
Miner #101: \n Ah!
Miner #101: \n Why me?
Mining Ship: \n Watch that debris from the event horizon.
Mining Ship: \n 100 units to clear the horizon.
Mining Ship: \n Entering atmosphere.
Mining Ship: \n Gravity levels at 73. Wavelength readings high at 403 to 510.
Mining Ship: \n #101, check your surroundings.
Miner #101: \n Visuals clear. Nothing unusual to report.
Mining Ship: \n Is your descent clear?
Miner #101: \n Descent is clear.
Mining Ship: \n 100 units left to atmospheric break.
Mining Ship: \n Brace for impact.
Mining Ship: \n You're inside the atmosphere.
Mining Ship: \n Vital signs nominal - you're clear for work.
Mining Ship: \n And you'll need to, if you want to make your quota.
Mining Ship: \n You'd better bring back a lot of ore.
Miner #101: \n #101 heading out to worksite.
Watch out!
The pressure seal's busted...
Hot hot hot!
Kat!
Get out of that suit!
Hold tight!
You've both been \n nothing but trouble \n since you showed up.
You didn't check the \n grav levels, did you?
No, we're really sorry \n about that.
Sorry doesn't \n cover our losses.
Two lost grav-suits... \n Our rules demand we \n always pay our debts.
Lisa, wait! \n Can we at least \n have dinner first?
No, and \n don't bother \n complaining.
I can't take it!
I shouldn't even have \n to care about gravity.
The nonsense about \n shifting gravity again?
Get back down \n to earth!
We're off!
Set course \n for Banga!
*Sigh* \n How did we end \n up like this?
Our troubles started with the incident at Neu Hiraleon. \n We were pulled into a horrific gravity storm and drifted through the rift planes...
When we awoke, we were with the boat people, \n who worked the city stolen by the storm for ore. \n Their leader, Lisa, treated us like her slaves.
The days when I was Hekseville's Gravity Queen seemed so long ago... \n I hadn't seen the other Gravity Shifter, Raven, or my partner Dusty since. \n All I had left was an empty stomach.
Alright, everyone, \n unload your things and begin inspection.
Mine
Miner #099: \n Finally! What took you?
Miner #101: \n Yeah, yeah.
Follow the Miner
Miner #099: \n We're working Zone 2, Block 3 today. It's over that way.
Miner #099: \n Let's just get this over with.
Miner #099: \n Hey, what are you doing?
Miner #099: \n Come on, do you want another reprimand?
Miner #099: \n Hey, you want to eat, don't you?
Miner #099: \n Rendezvoused with #101.
Mining Ship: \n Meet up with your unit and commence mining.
Mining Ship: \n Don't forget to keep an eye on your grav levels.
Miner #099: \n Hey, you're not still upset, are you?
Miner #101: \n Oh no, why would I be upset after you broke our equipment!?
Miner #101: \n Or after having to go look for you yesterday...
Miner #101: \n Only to find you asleep in the bathroom.
Miner #099: \n Hey, I had to pull an all-nighter fixing our gear.
Miner #101: \n But you made us late for work.
Miner #101: \n Thanks to you, we've gone two days without a solid meal.
Miner #099: \n The boss can be scary when she's upset.
Miner #101: \n And you have plenty of firsthand experience with that.
Miner #099: \n Oh, I almost forgot. I had a great dream last night.
Miner #099: \n I arrived just in the nick of time to save a princess.
Miner #099: \n We held hands and...
Miner #099: \n Well, I've got a feeling today's our lucky day.
Miner #101: \n Could you just give me a little peace and quiet?
Miner #101: \n I'm too hungry for all this talking.
Miner #099: \n Aww, come on. We just got out here!
Miner #101: \n So much for our lucky day.
Miner #099: \n There's no way we're going back empty-handed.
Miner #101: \n You know, that storm's just like the one before.
Miner #099: \n Alright, we've got the place to ourselves, let's get to work!
Miner #101: \n Are you crazy? You're ignoring a direct order.
Miner #099: \n We've got time before it hits. Let's take advantage of it.
Mining Group Leader: \n Gravitational readings are fluctuating. We've got a storm.
Mining Ship: \n Mining Site #4, you've got an incoming storm.
Mining Ship: \n All miners evacuate immediately.
Other Miner: \n They're calling off the dig. Evacuate!
Other Miner: \n Hurry up! And don't leave anything behind.
Other Miner: \n Get back to the drop point!
Other Miner: \n What are you doing, get back to the drop point!
Other Miner: \n You're working that way today.
Other Miner: \n This isn't your dig site, keep going.
Miner #099 \n Hey, where are you going?
Return to the \n Drop Point
Syd: \n I think I know where we are!
You do!?
Syd: \n Yeah, no mistaking it! Come on!
Syd: \n Agh!
Syd: \n We have to hurry!
Syd: \n Ugh, it feels like something's crushing my body.
I can... hardly breathe...
Syd: \n Come on, jump!
Syd: \n Whoa!
Syd: \n Well, we can't go that way.
Syd, look out!
Syd: \n Okay... This way!
I wish Dusty were here...
Syd: \n Don't worry, you've got me!
You're the reason we're in this mess!
Come on, Dusty... Where are you!?
My legs are done...
Lisa: \n Get on!
Syd: \n We've gotta get back to the drop site!
Syd: \n We can't go three days without food.
Starving beats this!
Syd: \n Aww, don't be that way!
Syd: \n I'm just going wherever we can.
Syd: \n Kat, what are you doing?
Syd: \n We've gotta go! It's too dangerous here.
Syd: \n Come on, something wrong?
Syd: \n The path's out!
Lisa!
Syd: \n Hurry, we can't hold on much longer!
Syd: \n We'll only last ten minutes at the most without the suits.
Ugh... My head feels like it's going to explode.
Syd: \n So much for this being our lucky day...
It's your fault for ignoring the evacuation order!
Syd: \n Come on, what was I supposed to do?
Syd: \n Sorry, Kat, I think we're in real trouble.
Are you sure this is the right way?
Syd: \n Who can be sure about anything in this storm!?
But that's reckless!
Syd: \n Trust me. I've got an instinct for these things.
More like an instinct for getting us into trouble...
Syd: \n What did you say?
Nothing!
i Move    j Adjust Camera
Miner #099: \n Hey, what are you doing?
Miner #099: \n Come on, do you want another reprimand?
Miner #099: \n Hey, you want to get left behind?
